A Barred Owl, Red tailed Hawk, and Peregrine Falcon were each housed in outdoor mews that did not provide a section
of adequate shelter from wind. Birds kept in captivity without an ability to access protection from the wind during inclement

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live birds.
citations.narrative:
Transport boxes for the raptors did not meet minimum ventilation standards and lacked projecting rims. Ventilation
openings of 16% of the surface area of two vertical walls, or 8% of all four walls, with a projecting rim of 0.75 inches
between the surface of the transport enclosure and any adjacent surfaces, are necessary to ensure that the birds are
given appropriate ventilation to prevent adverse health effects. The facility must ensure that transport containers meet
ventilation standards.
Correct from 19 March 2024 forward, prior to the next new site inspection.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
